gurmukhi: byK byK niRpwn ky ibhrMq bwlk sMg ] BwNq BwNqn ky Dry qn cIr rMg qrMg ]61]
transliteration: Bekh Bekh Nripaan Ke Bihrany Baalak San|| Bhaant Bhaantan Ked Dare Tan Cheer Ran Taran||61||
translation: Seeing all the princes moving together, eh waves of Saryu exhibited many coloured garments.61.

gurmukhi: AYs bwq BeI ieqY auh Er ibsÍwimqR ] j`g ko su krXo ArMBn qoKnwrQ ipqR ]
transliteration: Ais Baat Bhaiitai Uh Or Bisvaamitra|| Jagg Ko Su Daryo Aranbhan Tokhnaarath Pitra||
translation: All this was going on this side and on the other side Vishwamitra began a Yajna for the worship of his manes.

gurmukhi: hom kI lY bwsnw auT Dwq dYq durMq ] lUt Kwq sBY smgrI mwr kUt mhMq ]62]
transliteration: Hom Kilai Baasanaa Outh Dhaat Dait Durant|| Loot Khaat Sabhai Samagadimaar Koot Mahant||62||
translation: Attracted by the incense of fire-worship (Havana), the demons would come to the sacrificial pit and would eat the materials of Yajna, snatching it from the performer.62.

gurmukhi: lUt Kwqh ivKX jy iqn pY kCU n bswie ] qwk AauDh AwieXo qb ros kY muin rwie ]
transliteration: Loot Khaatah Vikhya Je Tin Pai Kachhodh Na Basaae|| Taak Audhah Aaeyo Tab Ros Kai Mounndi) Raae||
translation: Seeing the loot of the materials of the fire-worship and feeling himself helpless, the great sage Vishwamitra came to Ayodhya in great anger.

gurmukhi: Awie BUpq k`au khw suq dyhu mokau rwm ] nwqR qok`au Bsm kir h`au Awj hI ieh Twm ]63]
transliteration: Aae Bhoopat Kau Kahaa Sout Deh(u) Mokau Raam|| Naatra Tokaau Bhasam Kar(i) Bau Aaj Hieh Thaam||63||
translation: On reaching (Ayodhya) he said to the king. “Give me your son Ram for a few days, otherwise I shall reduce you to ashes on this very spot.”63.

gurmukhi: kop dyK munIs k`au niRp pUq qw sMg dIn ] j`g mMfl k`au clXo lY qwih sMig pRbIn ]
transliteration: Kop Dekh Mounndes Kau Nrip Poot Taa San Deen|| Jagg Mandal Kau Chadyo Lai Taah(i) San(i) Prabeen||
translation: Visualising the fury of the sage, the king asked his son to accompany him and the sage accompanied by Ram went to begin the Yajna again.

gurmukhi: eyk mwrg dUr hY iek nIAr hY suin rwm ] rwh mwrq rwCsI ijh qwrkw gin nwm ]64]
transliteration: Ek Maarg Door Hai Ik Neear Hai Soun(i) Raam|| Raah Maarat Raachhasijih Taarkaa Gad(i) Naam||64||
translation: The sage said, “O Ram ! listen, there are two routes, on the one the Yajna-spot is far away and on the other it is quit near, but on the later route there lives a demoness named Taraka, who kills the wayfares.64.

gurmukhi: jaun mwrg qIr hY iqh rwh cwlhu Awj ] ic`q icMq n kIjIAY idv dyv ky hYN kwj ]
transliteration: Jaoun Maarg Teer Hai Tih Raah Dhaaloh Aaj|| Chhitt Chint Na Keejeeai Div Dev De Hain Kaaj||
translation: Ram said, “Let us go by the small-distance-route, abandoning the anxiety, this work of killing the demons is the work of the gods.”

gurmukhi: bwit cwpY jwq hYN qb lau inswcr Awn ] jwhugy kq rwm kih mig roikXo qij kwn ]65]
transliteration: Baattee Chaapai Jaat Hain Tab Lau Nisaachar Aan|| Jaahouge Kat Raam Kah(i) Mag(i) Rokiyo Taj(i) Kaan||65||
translation: They began to move on that route and at the same time the demoness came and laid obstruction on the path saying, “O ram ! how will you proceed and save yourself?”65.

gurmukhi: dyK rwm inswcrI gih lIn bwn kmwn ] Bwl mD pHwirXo sur qwn kwn pRmwn ]
transliteration: Dekh Raam Nisaacharigad(i) Leen Baan Kamaan|| Dhaal Madh Prahaariyo Sur Taan Kaan Pramaan||
translation: On seeing the demoness Tarka, ram held his bow and arrows in his hand, and pulling the cow discharged the arrow on her head.

gurmukhi: bwn lwgq hI igrI ibsMBwru dyih ibswl ] hwiQ sRI rGunwQ ky BXo pwpnI ko kwl ]66]
transliteration: Baan Laagad Higiribisanbhaar(u) Deh(i) Bidaal|| Haath(i) Sriraghounaath Ke Bhyo Paapaniko Kaal||66||
translation: On being struck by the arrow, the heavy body of the demoness fell down and in this way, he end of the sinner came at the hands of Ram.66.

gurmukhi: AYs qwih sMGwr kY kr j`g mMfl mMf ] Awiegy qb lau inswcr dIh dyie pRcMf ]
transliteration: Ais Taah(i) Sanhaar Kai Kar Jagg Mandal Mand|| Aaege Tab Lau Nisaachar Deeh Doe Prachanndd||
translation: In this way, after killing the demoness, when the Yajna was started, two large-sized demons, Marich and Subahu, appeared there.

gurmukhi: Bwj Bwj cly sBY irK TwF By hiT rwm ] ju`D kRu`D krXo iqhUM iqh Taur sorh jwm ]67]
transliteration: Bhaaj Bhaaj Chale Sabhai Rich Thaadh Bhe Hath(i) Raam|| Juddh Kruddh Daryo Tihoon Tih Thaur Sorah Jaam||67||
translation: Seeing them, all the sages ran away and only Ram persistently stood there and the war of those three was waged continuously for sixteen watches.67.

gurmukhi: mwr mwr pukwr dwnv ssqR AsqR sMBwr ] bwn pwn kmwn k`au Dr qbr iq`C kuTwr ]
transliteration: Maar Maar Poukaar Daanav Sastra Astra Sanbhaar|| Baan Paan Kamaan Kau Dhar Tabar Tichchh Kouthaar||
translation: Holding firmly their arms and weapons, the demons began to shout “kill, kill”; they caught hold of their axes, bows and arrows in their hands.
